sen.j: 関山慧玄（かんざん えげん、建治3年（1277年） - 正平 (日本)15年/延文5年12月12日 (旧暦)（1361年1月19日））は、鎌倉時代末期から南北朝時代 (日本)の臨済宗の僧。
sen.e: Kanzan Egen (1277 - January 19, 1361) was a monk of the Rinzai sect of Buddhism from the latter stages of the Kamakura period to the Northern & Southern Dynasty period.
Kanzan Egen (1277 - January 19, 1361) was a monk of the Rinzai sect of Buddhism from the latter stages of the Kamakura period to the Northern & Southern Dynasty period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Kanzan Egen (1277 - January 19, 1361) was a monk of the Rinzai sect of Buddhism from the latter stages of the Kamakura period to the Northern and Southern Courts period (Japan).
sen.cmt: 南北朝 の表現を変更しました。

sen.j: 信濃国（長野県）の出身で、家は高梨氏で、高梨高家の子とされる。
sen.e: Born in Shinano Province (Nagano Prefecture), his family was part of the Takanashi clan and he was a child of Koke (?) TAKANASHI.
sen.cmt: 高家 Koke?
sen.e: Born in Shinano Province (Nagano Prefecture), his family was part of the Takanashi clan and he was a child of Koke (?) TAKANASHI.
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: It is said that he was born in Shinano Province (Nagano Prefecture), his family was a member of the Takanashi clan and he was a son of Takaie TAKANASHI.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 朝廷から本有円成、仏心、覚照、大定聖応、光徳勝妙、自性天真、放無量光の国師号が与えられ、また、明治天皇から大師 (僧)臨済宗と諡された。
sen.e: The title of master was bestowed on him 7 times by imperial courts. Also, the title of Daishi ('Revered Master') of the Rinzai sect was posthumously conferred by Emperor Meiji.
sen.cmt: Loose translation. I could not find accurate references to the title readings. Ref: Baroni p 178
sen.e: The title of master was bestowed on him 7 times by imperial courts. Also, the title of Daishi ('Revered Master') of the Rinzai sect was posthumously conferred by Emperor Meiji.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: He was given such seven Kokushi-go (title for the most reverend priest) by the Imperial Court as Honyuensei, Busshin, Kakusho, Daijoshoo, Kotokushomyo, Jishotenshin and Homuryoko; the title of Daishi (Revered Master) of the Rinzai sect was also posthumously given to him by Emperor Meiji.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 1307年に鎌倉の建長寺に入り、南浦紹明に師事。
sen.e: In 1307 entered Kencho-ji Temple in Kamakura and, studied under Jomyo NAMPO.
In 1307, entered Kencho-ji Temple in Kamakura and studied under Jomyo NAMPO.
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: In 1307, he started to study in Kencho-ji Temple in Kamakura under Jomyo NANPO.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 慧眼の戒名を授かり、南浦寂後も鎌倉にあって物外可什、巨山志源などに参禅。
sen.e: Given the posthumous name of "Keigan" (Insightful), after Nampo's death he found himself again in Kamakura and practiced Zen with Kaju MOTSUGAI, 巨山志源 (reading unknown) and others.
sen.cmt: 慧眼?物外可什、巨山志源?
sen.e: Given the posthumous name of "Keigan" (Insightful), after Nampo's death he found himself again in Kamakura and practiced Zen with Kaju MOTSUGAI, 巨山志源 (reading unknown) and others.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: He was given the Buddhist name of Egan (Insightful), and after the death of NANPO, he still remained in Kamakura and practiced Zen mediation under Motsugai Kaju, Gozan Shigen, and other priests.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しましたNANPOを大文字にしました

sen.j: その後帰郷。
sen.e: Afterwards returns home.
Afterwards returns home.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: After that, he returned home.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 建長寺開山・蘭渓道隆五十年忌出席のため再び建長寺に参じ、ここで宗峰妙超（大燈国師）を紹介され、京都大徳寺に遷って宗峰に師事。
sen.e: He returned to participate in the 50th anniversaries of the founding of Kencho-ji Temple and the death of its founder Doryu RANKEI (aka Lanqi Daolong). Here he is introduced to Shuho Myocho) (posthumous name: Daito Kokushi (Master)) and transfers to Daitoku-ji Temple in Kyoto to study under Shuho.
sen.cmt: *http://www.myoshinji.or.jp/english/history.html`*The illustrated encyclopedia of Zen Buddhism 著者: Helen Josephine Baroni p 61`*Themes in the history of Japanese garden art 著者: Wybe Kuitert
sen.e: He returned to participate in the 50th anniversaries of the founding of Kencho-ji Temple and the death of its founder Doryu RANKEI (aka Lanqi Daolong). Here he is introduced to Shuho Myocho) (posthumous name: Daito Kokushi (Master)) and transfers to Daitoku-ji Temple in Kyoto to study under Shuho.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: He returned to Kencho-ji Temple in order to attend the fiftieth anniversary of the establishment of Kencho-ji Temple and of the death of its founder, Doryu RANKEI (aka Lanqi Daolong); there he was introduced to Shuho Myocho (posthumous name: Daito Kokushi (Master)) and went to Daitoku-ji Temple in Kyoto to study under Shuho.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: やがて1329年に雲門文偃の関字の公案で開悟し、宗峰がこれを証明して関山の号が与えられ、慧玄と改名した。
sen.e: After a lengthy period he was confirmed by Shuho as having achieved enlightenment ('koan') and changed his name to Egen.
sen.cmt: very esoteric
sen.e: After a lengthy period, he was confirmed by Shuho as having achieved enlightenment ('koan') and changed his name to Egen.
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: In 1329 Egan attained enlightenment through Koan (zen question for meditation) owing to Seki questioned by a Zen monk, Unmon Bunen, which was confirmed by Shuho, and Egen was given the title, Kanzan, and changed his name to Egen.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました年号の間違いを修正

sen.j: その後、後醍醐天皇に法を説くなどしたが、のち美濃国の伊深に草庵を結んで隠棲した。
sen.e: Afterwards he ministered to retired Emperor Godaigo but, subsequently retreats to a secluded life in a thatched hut in Ibuka, Mino Province.
Afterwards, he ministered to the retired Emperor Godaigo but, subsequently retreated to a secluded life in a thatched hut in Ibuka, Mino Province.
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: After that, he preached the Buddhism to Emperor Godaigo; later he retreated to a secluded life in a thatched hut in Ibuka, Mino Province.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 1337年、花園天皇は、離宮を禅苑に改めてその寺名命名と開山となる禅僧の推薦を宗峰に依頼。
sen.e: In 1337 Emperor Hanazono converts an imperial villa into a Zen retreat and requests Shuho to recommend a Zen priest to formally name and establish a temple.
In 1337, Emperor Hanazono converted an imperial villa into a Zen retreat and requested Shuho to recommend a Zen priest to formally name and establish a temple.
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: In 1337, Emperor Hanazono converted an imperial villa into a Zen retreat and asked Shuho to name the retreat and recommend a Zen priest who would establish a temple there.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました原文の内容に沿うように修正しましたNeilさん、ご確認ください。

sen.j: 宗峰が関山を推挙し、関山は妙心寺開山となった。
sen.e: Shuho recommends Kanzan, and Kanzan gives the place the name "Myoshin-ji Temple".
Shuho recommended Kanzan, and Kanzan gives the place the name "Myoshin-ji Temple".
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: Shuho recommended Kanzan, and Kanzan established the Myoshin-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しましたスペースを挿入

sen.j: 禅風は厳格で、その生活は質素をきわめ、枯淡な禅風で修禅に専念したという。
sen.e: The style of Zen was very severe, the lifestyle simple to the extreme, and is said to have become absorbed in shuzen (combination of zazen and contemplation).
The style of Zen was very severe, the lifestyle simple to the extreme, and is said to have become absorbed in shuzen (combination of zazen and contemplation).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: It is said that his Zen style was very strict, his lifestyle was extremely simple, and he devoted himself to Zen training.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました主語を関山と取るほうが良いと思い、修正しました。

sen.j: 『沙石集』には｢本朝ならびなき禅哲なり｣と称賛されている。
sen.e: In the "Shuseki"(tiny stones) anthology, the 'imperial court side by side with Zen philosophy' was admired.
In the "Shuseki"(tiny stones) anthology, the 'imperial court side by side with Zen philosophy' was admired.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: "Shasekishu" (tiny stones) admired him as 'the greatest Zen philosopher in Japan.'
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 形式に拘らず厳しく弟子を指導し、法嗣は授翁宗弼（じゅおう そうひつ）ただ一人であり、また妙心寺の伽藍整備や経営に拘泥することはなかった。
sen.e: Irrespective of formalities, students were severely disciplined, Juo Sohitsu was the sole individual charged with handing on the sect's lore and also, Kanzan was not particular about Myoshin-ji Temple's maintenance or management.

Irrespective of formalities, students were severely disciplined, Juo Sohitsu was the sole individual charged with handing the sect's lore and also, Kanzan was not particular about Myoshin-ji Temple's maintenance or management.
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: Kanzan was not particular about formalities, the maintenance or the management of Myoshin-ji Temple but taught his students strictly; Juo Sohitsu was the only hoshi (successor who is in charge of handing the sect's lore).
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しましたスペルを修正

sen.j: 1360年12月12日、関山は旅の支度をして授翁に行脚に出るといい、「風水泉」と称する井戸の辺で授翁に遺戒し、立ったまま息をひきとった。
sen.e: On December 12, 1360, it is said the Kanzan made preparations to go on a pilgrimage to see Sohitsu. Supposedly on the basis of feng shui (geomancy), Sohitsu cautioned him about venturing near wells and then suddenly, took his last gasp.

On December 12, 1360, it is said the Kanzan made preparations to go on a pilgrimage to see Sohitsu. Supposedly on the basis of feng shui (geomancy), Sohitsu cautioned him about venturing near wells and then suddenly, took his last gasp.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: On December 12, 1360, Kanzan told Juo that he was going on a pilgrimage, gave Juo his parting advice near the well named 'Fusuisen', and passed away standing.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました2つ目のKanzanを削除

sen.j: 遺戒は授翁が門下の雲山宗峨に成文させ、今日｢無相大師遺誡｣と称し読誦されている。
sen.e: Sohitsu had the monk Unzan Soga write his parting advice to hang under a gate, and today the words are read aloud as "Master Muso's dying instructions".
Sohitsu had the monk Unzan Soga write his parting advice to hang under a gate, and today the words are read aloud as "Master Muso's dying instructions".
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Juo made Unzan Soga, one of Kanzan's disciples, write Kanzan's parting advice, which is called 'Muso-daishi yuikai (Master Muso's teachings to posterity) and chanted.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 関山には他の高僧のような語録や著書はなく、生前に描かれた肖像もなく、遺筆も弟子の授翁宗弼に書き与えた印可状以外にほとんど残されていない。
sen.e: Kanzan did not leave any literary work behind like other venerated priests. There is no portrait of him made during his lifetime. His writings were given to his follower Sohitsu and besides a certificate of enlightenment. Little else remains.

Kanzan did not leave any literary work behind like other venerated priests. There was no portrait of him made during his lifetime, and his writings were given to his follower Sohitsu, and besides a certificate of enlightenment, little else remains.
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: Unlike other high priests, Kanzan did not leave any literary works behind; no portrait of him was made during his lifetime; he left only a few of his writings except Inkajo (a certificate of enlightenment) given to Juo Sohitsu, his diciple.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: さらに遺命して肖像を残させなかったため、今日の関山像は後世に作成された物である。
sen.e: In particular, as he died leaving no portrait, portraits of Kanzan today were made after he passed away.
In particular, as he died leaving no portrait, portraits of Kanzan today were made after he passed away.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Since, in accordance with his will, no portraits of Kanzan were made, any portraits of him that can be seen today were made after his death.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しましたin→byとしました

sen.j: 南浦紹明（大応国師）から宗峰妙超（大灯国師）を経て関山慧玄へ続く法系を「応灯関」といい、現在、日本臨済宗はみなこの法系に属する。
sen.e: Following the passing of venerated Master Jomyo NAMPO, and the enlightened Master Doryu RANKEI (aka Lanqi Daolong), the teachings continued through Kanzan Egen as "revelations" it is said. Currently, all members of Japan's Rinzai sect are subject to these teachings.

Following the passing of venerated Master Jomyo NAMPO, and the enlightened Master Doryu RANKEI (aka Lanqi Daolong), the teachings continued through Kanzan Egen as "revelations" it is said. Currently, all members of Japan's Rinzai sect are subject to these teachings.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The line of Zen law that started from Jomyo NANPO (Daio Kokushi) to Shuho Myocho (Daito Kokushi) and then to Kanzan Egen is called 'Otokan' and all the priests of Japanese Rinzai sect belong to this line.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 関山の禅は、後に系統に白隠が出て大いに繁栄し、他の臨済宗諸派が絶法したのに対し、その法灯を今日に伝えている。
sen.e: Kanzan's system of Zen was carried on afterwards by Hakuin and flourished greatly and in contrast to suppression of other branches of the Rinzai sect, those teachings of Buddha are passed on to this day.
sen.cmt: 絶法?法灯teachings of Buddha Kenkyusha 4 p494
sen.e: Kanzan's system of Zen was carried on afterwards by Hakuin and flourished greatly and in contrast to suppression of other branches of the Rinzai sect, those teachings of Buddha are passed on to this day.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Kanzan's teaching of Zen was flourished greatly by Hakuin and has been passed on up to the present time while other branches of the Rinzai sect died out.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 2006年に臨済宗妙心寺派の寺の蔵より肖像画が発見された。
sen.e: In 2006 a portrait was discovered in the temple strong room of the Myoshin-ji Temple school of the Rinzai sect.
In 2006, a portrait was discovered in the temple strong room of the Myoshin-ji Temple school of the Rinzai sect.
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: In 2006, a portrait was discovered in the temple storeroom of the Myoshin-ji Temple school of the Rinzai sect.
sen.cmt: storeroom としました。

sen.j: 年代鑑定を行っていない模様で生前に描かれたものか否かは不明である。
sen.e: No judgment has been made of the era and whether or not the painting was made during his lifetime or not is unclear.
No judgment has been made of the era, and whether or not the painting was made during his lifetime or not, is unclear.
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: It seems that the time of making the portrait has not been examined, and it is unclear whether it was made during his lifetime or not.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 妙心寺が全国で行っている年忌法要の席で見ることが出来る。
sen.e: Myoshin-ji Temple is holding Buddhist annual memorial services nation wide where it can be viewed.
Myoshin-ji Temple holds annual Buddhist memorial services nationwide where it can be viewed.
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: The portrait can be seen at annual Buddhist memorial services held nation-widely by Myoshin-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました
